e_aquar11_a_nm=Jack, the boat seller
e_aquar11_a_dsc=On the south pier, you find a boat sales stand. When you approach, a crocoman appears behind the counter and says:<br><br>"Hello travelers, if you want a boat to navigate the marsh, this is the best store in the area. I am Jack, a seller affiliated with the global merchants association, and I always offer the best prices, whatever some may say.<br><br>The price of a boat is 800g."
e_aquar11_a_dsca=Do you want to buy a boat?
e_aquar11_a_rp0=You don't want to buy anything.
e_aquar11_a_rp0_s=You say goodbye to Jack and go on your way.
e_aquar11_a_rp1=You pay the 800g to buy a boat.
e_aquar11_a_rp1_s=After receiving the 800g, Jack goes to the pier and prepares a boat for you.<br><br>Now you can go through the waters of the marsh.
e_aquar11_a_rp2=Try to get it for 500g or you won't buy it.
e_aquar11_a_rp2_s=Seeing that he doesn't seem to have many customers, you manage to convince him to let you have a boat for 500g.<br><br>Now you can go through the waters of the marsh.
e_aquar11_a_rp2_f=Being a crocoman, he is stubborn, and you do not convince him to lower the price of the boat.<br><br>Since you don't have much else to do, you leave.
e_aquar11_a_rp2_sc=After talking to him for a while, he likes you and gives you a boat for 300g.<br><br>Now you can go through the waters of the marsh.
e_aquar11_a_rp2_fc=The crocoman doesn't take your bargaining offer very well, and asks you to leave the pier before he calls his friends.<br><br>You leave rather humiliated after your attempt to bargain.
e_aquar11_a_rp3=Show the VIP card and pay 400g for the boat.
e_aquar11_a_rp3_s=You show the card to Jack, and he immediately offers you a 50% discount. You pay the 400g, and he prepares a boat for you.<br><br>Now you can go through the waters of the marsh.
e_aquar11_a_rp4=Tell him Irwin sent you for a free boat.
e_aquar11_a_rp4_s=Jack immediately recognizes Irwin's name as the crocomen leader and his boss. You tell him how you helped conquer the battlefield, and he promised you a boat. Without thinking twice, Jack goes to the dock and prepares a boat for you.<br><br>Now you can go through the waters of the swamp.
e_aquar13_a_nm=A tough choice
e_aquar13_a_dsc=You arrive at a ravine full of cobwebs and cocoons. Some of the cocoons seem freshly made.<br><br>As you get closer, the cocoons start to shake... There are people inside! e_aquar13_a_dsca=What do you want to do?

e_sewers8_a_nm=The king's dark deal
e_sewers8_a_dsc=You find yourselves in front of the king of the ratmen. With a gesture, he invites you to approach and says:<br><br>"I didn't expect to have visitors who didn't come from the well... Maybe we could make a deal.<br><br>In exchange for the jewelry and some vitality of one of you, I'll use my corruption magic to upgrade their weapon. e_sewers8_a_dsca=What do you say? Does anyone take the deal?"
e_sewers8_a_rp0=You attack him right away, while he waits for a response.

e_sewers8_a_rp1=You try to buy time by prolonging the conversation and recovering your strength.

e_pyr3_6_nm=The ancient mural
e_pyr3_6_dsc=In the corner of the large corridor, you find a very ancient mural.<br><br>The mural is full of very old glyphs and most of them are unrecognizable to you. Even so, your general impression is that the mural depicts the origins of the pyramid.<br><br>Upon closer inspection, you realize that several of the glyphs can be moved and rotated. e_pyr3_6_dsca=Do you want to try to reposition the glyphs?
e_pyr3_6_rp0=You think it's better not to move anything and you leave.
e_pyr3_6_rp0_s=rptd_e_aquar18_a_rp0_s
e_pyr3_6_rp1=You try to reposition the glyphs to reread the mural.
e_pyr3_6_rp1_s=As you move the glyphs indiscriminately, you hear a voice echoing down the hall.<br><br>(Basthet) "Ignorance is not allowed here!"<br><br>Suddenly a holy bolt falls from the ceiling and hits you. You decide it's best to stop touching the glyphs and walk away hurt.
e_pyr3_6_rp2=You had a vision of this mural when you fainted in the desert!
e_pyr3_6_rp2_s=You move the glyphs to place them as you saw them in your vision.<br><br>Although you still do not understand the meaning of the mural, it seems obvious to you that they are now in the correct position.<br><br>As you place the last glyph correctly, a holy light descends from the ceiling and envelops you.
e_pyr3_6_rp3=I never understood this mural... but I know that it's better not to touch it.
e_pyr3_6_rp3_s=Laia tells you that when she was little, Basthet warned her not to touch the mural. Even so, when she grew a bit older and believed that Basthet would not see her... she made several attempts to move the glyphs to solve the mural.<br><br>All of them resulted in a punishment from Basthet and a warning that ignorance was not to her liking.<br><br>After hearing this, you decide that it is better not to touch the mural and you leave.
e_pyr3_6_rp4=Indeed, the glyphs are misplaced. This mural controls various systems of the pyramid.
e_pyr3_6_rp4_s=(Navalea) "One day, this pyramid appeared out of nowhere on the sands of Ulminin. e_ulmin8_a_rp2=You pay 300g and ask about how felines live in this desert.
e_ulmin8_a_rp2_s=(Feline) "The felines settled in the oasis and near the great pyramid a few centuries ago. e_ulmin8_a_rp3=You pay 300g and ask about the stone door in the gorge.
e_ulmin8_a_rp3_s="It is said that the stone door and its inner halls were built in ancient times by an architect named Galatea.<br><br>If you want to go there, you will have to descend the gorge, I think in the abandoned camp to the east we left a hidden rope, you could use it to descend it. e_ulmin8_a_rp4=You pay 300g and ask for information about the eastern desert.
e_ulmin8_a_rp4_s=(Feline) "There are several things you should know if you go east. e_velka41_a_nm=The time rift
e_velka41_a_dsc=On the slope of the volcano you see a flickering glow that catches your attention. As you approach, a large eldritch rift forms before you.<br><br>You stand on guard, but no horror comes out of it, and you realize that this rift is unlike any you have seen before.<br><br>It is larger, and the energy that emanates from it is completely different from the other rifts. You look through it, and it does not seem to lead to another place... but to the same place you are in, however, different...
e_velka41_a_dsca=Do you want to cross the rift?
e_velka41_a_rp0=You dare to venture into the unknown.
e_velka41_a_rp0_s=Showing off your adventurous spirit, you cross the rift without hesitation.<br><br>When you get to the other side, you quickly realize that you are surely in the same place. However, there is less ash and the volcano seems to be less active.<br><br>A little dizzy, you look around and see a tunnel on the side of the volcano, a small camp, soldiers, and suddenly... Your eyes close and you briefly lose consciousness.
e_velka41_a_rp1=As it seems dangerous, you prefer not to cross the rift.
e_velka41_a_rp1_s=You think it is too risky to enter an unknown rift that suddenly appeared.<br><br>You leave the place and leave the rift behind.
e_uprising1_a_nm=The backup group
e_uprising1_a_dsc=Crossing the rift was a harder toll than you thought, but you quickly regain consciousness.<br><br>When you open your eyes, you see that a soldier from the nearby camp approaches you and says:<br><br>"You must be the backup group! Perfect, the vanguard has already entered the volcano, led by the king's advisor Amelia and Chancellor Cornelius of the Burning Hand.
e_uprising1_a_dsca=You must not waste any more time. You must enter through the tunnel and reach them to help them quell the Obsidian Uprising."
e_uprising1_a_rp0=The Obsidian Uprising? What's going on here?
e_uprising1_a_rp0_s=(Soldier) "You know... the dwarves have begun a conquest of Velkarath, they are building war machines with obsidian from the volcano and a new energy source. We have come here to stop them... aren't you here for that?"<br><br>The soldier looks at you confused and you, after hearing that, look around and realize that the rift has taken you to the past, specifically to the Velkarath of 30 years ago.<br><br>Although you are somewhat stunned by this fact, you agree to enter the tunnel towards the volcano, before more soldiers arrive and you attract more attention.
e_uprising1_a_rp1=I have the feeling I know what happened...
e_uprising1_a_rp1_s=Amelia hides behind the group so that the soldiers won't recognize her and urges the group to accept. When you are alone and enter the tunnel she says:<br><br>(Amelia) "The rift we crossed must have been a time rift and, it has sent us back in time, specifically 30 years ago. We have to find another time rift so we can return to our time.<br><br>I remember this tunnel... together with Cornelius, Nenukil, Wilbur and a small group of soldiers, we entered the volcano to quell the uprising. In the end, after several unforeseen events, we defeated the dwarf generals and managed to escape from the volcano.<br><br>Chasing myself seems weird... I hope everything goes well..."
e_uprising1_a_rp2=What are you talking about? The uprising was 30 years ago...
e_uprising1_a_rp2_s=(Soldier) "Stop, what's a dwarf doing here? Although you look a lot like the dwarf who was with advisor Amelia... Maybe you're a relative and have also come to help?"<br><br>After hearing that, Nenukil, stunned, takes a good look at his surroundings and realizes... The rift has taken him back in time, specifically 30 years ago, when Nenukil helped Amelia quell the uprising of his people. Nenukil's face pales little by little just thinking about having to relive the fall of the Black Forge.<br><br>Without many other options and in order not to attract more attention, you agree to enter the tunnel in the hopes of finding a way to return to your time.
e_uprising1_a_rp3=Cornelius? But that's me... right?
e_uprising1_a_rp3_s=The soldier is confused, but the one who is even more confused than usual is old Cornelius... To avoid causing a scene, you take Cornelius and agree to enter the tunnel. As you approach, Cornelius has a moment of lucidity and says:<br><br>(Cornelius) "Oh... I see, we're in the past. This must be when those damn dwarves started building machines and attacked my people... They killed dozens of members of the Burning Hand, including my son and his wife.<br><br>When advisor Amelia came with her army, I voluntarily joined her to seek revenge and put an end to the machines that harmed my people. Although I don't remember very well how everything ended..."
e_uprising1_a_rp4=Follow me into the tunnel and give me a moment.
e_uprising1_a_rp4_s=Wilbur urges you to follow him, and when he reaches the tunnel, he takes out one of his books and starts flipping through the pages, after a while he says:<br><br>(Wilbur) "As I suspected... mmm... it must have been the rift we crossed, but without a doubt we are in the past, specifically 30 years ago.<br><br>At that time, I was studying some dwarven engineering books in the Black Forge, when the dwarven uprising happened and I was kicked out of there. I joined Amelia's group to help her and, in the process, pick up those books.<br><br>I have the feeling that we were destined to come to the past, I still can't confirm it... but the way events happened, it could be that... Anyway, our only option to return to our time is to go forward."
e_uprising1_a_rp5=Something's not right... it seems as if...
e_uprising1_a_rp5_s=When the soldier sees Nezglekt he gets nervous and is about to raise the alarm. Luckily, Nezglekt quickly hypnotizes him and begins to read his mind, shortly after he says:<br><br>(Nezglekt) "Aha, I see... it seems like we're in the past, specifically about 30 years ago. It must have been because of the rift we crossed.<br><br>It seems that at this time the Black Forge was still in operation and that it was just after this uprising that it was closed down. I've always been curious to see what it was like... Anyway, I detect a temporal energy similar to the crack we came from inside the forge. If we want to return to our time, we will have to go in and find it."

e_uprising6_a_nm=The stuck elevator
e_uprising6_a_dsc=You reach the elevator leading to the next floor of the dwarven city, but it is stopped on the floor above you.<br><br>You try to call it up using a small lever, but unfortunately, it doesn't work.<br><br>After examining the lever, you realize that the mechanism is missing a small gear, and without it there is no way to bring it down from the floor above.
e_uprising6_a_dsca=Your only chance to get to the next floor is to climb up the elevator chain. 
e_uprising6_a_rp0=Try to climb up the chain one after the other.
e_uprising6_a_rp0_s=You manage to climb the chain to the next floor without difficulty.
e_uprising6_a_rp0_f=As you are climbing the chain, your strength weakens and you fall, breaking a couple of bones.<br><br>Those who have climbed up come down with the elevator to pick you up.
e_uprising6_a_rp1=I know where the missing gear is...
e_uprising6_a_rp1_s=(Amelia) "I remember back then we thought we wouldn't have reinforcements and we were worried the dwarves would ambush us from behind. So Wilbur suggested we disable the elevator's calling mechanism and hide the missing gear nearby.<br><br>I'm going to pick it up and call the elevator... although I'm worried about the implications of meeting my younger self... and the consequences that would trigger."<br><br>Amelia calls the elevator and you all go up to the next floor with it.
e_uprising6_a_rp2=I have several of these gears with me and can repair the mechanism.
e_uprising6_a_rp2_s=(Nenukil) "Ha... I remember telling Amelia that removing the gear would be of little use. Since any dwarf worth his salt in this forge always carries that type of gear with him... How ironic that I am the one who is going to replace that gear.<br><br>Even so, I have a hard time believing that we are here again... Maybe this time I can avoid what happened and save the forge..."<br><br>Nenukil calls the elevator while he mutters to himself and you all go up to the next floor with it.
e_uprising6_a_rp3=I can't believe I'm in this damn forge again...
e_uprising6_a_rp3_s=(Cornelius) "This has to be a nightmare, I must be dreaming again... Although my companions are different this time and the heat is very real...<br><br>I remember that in this elevator Amelia and Wilbur hid something over there. Then when we went up we fought tirelessly and faced the dwarven war machine... and the explosions happened..."<br><br>Cornelius looks quite tired and bewildered. While he rests for a while, you look in the place he indicated and find the missing gear to call elevator.
e_uprising6_a_rp4=I hid the missing gear over there, I'm going to pick it up.
e_uprising6_a_rp4_s=(Wilbur) "After studying for several months in the forge, I knew perfectly well that hiding this gear to disable the elevator would not be of much use...<br><br>Even so, I suggested to Amelia that hopefully we would delay a possible dwarven ambush from the rear and give us some time to complete our mission and pick up my study books on the way."<br><br>Wilbur calls the elevator and you all go up to the next floor with it.

e_uprising12_a_dsc=You see a dwarf with a stiff stance looking severe. His gaze is on the elevator, until it stops in the upper levels. He turns and speaks to you.<br><br>(Dwarf) Argh... e_uprising15_a_dsc=When you are about to reach young Amelia and escape the forge, a rift appears between your party and her. This portal is like the one that brought you here.<br><br>You cant waste this opportunity to go back to the present and without thinking twice, you cross the rift.<br><br>Just before going back to your time, you are able to see how the explosions and the lava engulf the Black Forge.
e_uprising15_a_dsca=That is how your adventure in the past ends. 
e_uprising15_a_rp0=You are back in present Velkarath. 
e_uprising15_a_rp0_s=History tells that when advisor Amelia came back to Senenthia, she reported what happened in the Black Forge.<br><br>In her report, she wrote about a group of irregular soldiers that helped her and her party to end with the Obsidian Uprising, but unfortunately, that group didnt survive. To honor that group, a monument was built in the city of Velkarath.<br><br>Advisor Amelia rewarded the three heroes who helped her, and she forgave the surviving dwarves of the Black Forge, as long as they swear to abandon the research and machinery they produced during the Obsidian Uprising.  
e_uprising15_a_rp1=It has been an... interesting experience.
e_uprising15_a_rp1_s=(Amelia) Todays events helped me to understand some details that I didnt know about the uprising event. I reported that a group of irregulars helped us to quell the uprising, but they didnt make it out of the Forge. I never expected that I myself was part of that group!<br><br>That experience forged a bond between Nenukil, Wilbur, Cornelius and me. I offered them a reward after that, whatever they wanted.<br><br>Wilbur asked for help with his new research, Nenukil asked to become part of my retinue and Cornelius asked me... a personal favor. 
e_uprising15_a_rp2=Its a shame, I couldnt stop it.   
e_uprising15_a_rp2_s=(Nenukil) I thought I could change how things went that time. We were so close... Those opportunistic generals doomed a lot of my people and tainted our good name. I will never forgive them.<br><br>After that event, I asked Amelia to be fair with the surviving dwarves and I swore to join her as her loyal vassal.<br><br>Amelia accepted. The surviving dwarves could establish in Senenthia, and I was at her side until the day she decided to exile herself in order to protect us all."
e_uprising15_a_rp3=Is it really over? At last?
e_uprising15_a_rp3_s=Cornelius calms once he realizes he is out of the Forge.<br><br>(Cornelius) Now I remember this nightmare clearly. I did what I had to do in order to save us all.<br><br>The fight against the dwarf general was exhausting. I was weakened, at my limit, and summoning Belphyor took a great toll on my mind and strength.<br><br>I knew my mind would start to fail me soon and I wouldnt be able to take care of the only person I had left, my newborn granddaughter, Evelyn. So, before things got worse, I asked Amelia to take care of her."
e_uprising15_a_rp4=So after all this time...
e_uprising15_a_rp4_s=(Wilbur) Since that day, I have always been obsessed with a cool dwarf on a floating machine that I saw down there.<br><br>A dwarf on a floating machine, moving through the battlefield with ease and grace. I only saw it in passing, but I couldnt focus on him, because that general was a very hard fight!<br><br>And now everything is clear. Of course, it shouldnt surprise me. It wasnt a dwarf. The great inspiration of my life is... myself!

e_sahti21_a_nm=The Loas passage
e_sahti21_a_dsc=You arrive at a cave with impressive carvings on its entrance, depicting several Loa. It appears that the carvings were once painted, but most of the color has faded over time. <br><br>It's now impossible to determine whether the painted sections depicted the feats of the engraved Loas or those of lesser Loas.<br><br>A humid breeze carrying a blend of cinnamon and bitterness emanates from the cave. The cave is the largest you have seen in the area and seems to extend deeper than initially anticipated.
e_sahti21_a_dsca=Do you dare to enter this cave?
e_sahti21_a_rp0=There is something ominous here. Lets look for another way.
e_sahti21_a_rp0_s=You feel a strong instinct urging you to avoid entering the cave. <br><br>Heeding this feeling, you bypass the cave and continue your journey on the surface.
e_sahti21_a_rp1=This is the place the elder told us about. Lets go.
e_sahti21_a_rp1_s=The cave, illuminated by bioluminescent plants, exudes an eerie aura.<br><br>The walls are adorned with depictions of the Loas deeds, leading you further into the depths. e_sunken10_a_nm=The Spirit Altar
e_sunken10_a_dsc=This altar is dedicated to honoring the Great Bird as the lord of magic and the elements. e_sunken19_b_nm=The spider grotto

An old shrine dedicated to some ancient spider spirit that I discovered while working as a priestess in the Great Birds temple. This was a place where I could meditate and escape the Great Birds influence. I learned a lot here.

e_sunken19_b_rp1=What else do you know of this shrine?
e_sunken19_b_rp1_s=(Tulah): This shrine predates the Great Birds temple itself. Before the Great Birds arrival, all creatures in Aquarfall lived under the protection of the Spider Spirit, who chose this spot for her shrine, as it is where all the magical energies of the swamp converge.<br><br>But as the races of Aquarfall grew in strength and number, they no longer needed the vigilant watch of the Spider Spirit. When the Great Bird arrived and imposed its authority, it had its followers build their main temple here to take advantage of the magical convergence.<br><br>Over time, the spider shrine was forgotten by the temple priestesses, but I stumbled upon it while searching for a place to meditate, far from the Great Birds horrors. The Spider Spirit spoke to me and shared her knowledge. But enough stories, we have a bird to hunt. I have some items here that may prove useful.

e_sunken1_a_rp1=Aquarfall has changed so much... yet so little.

e_sunken27_a_dsc=In the center of a vast arena stands an altar crackling with energy, surrounded by glittering treasures. e_sunken28_a_dsc=After the defeat of the Great Bird, a portal similar to the one that brought you here appears nearby, and you all feel compelled to cross it. <br><br>Your last thought before crossing the portal is of the cold-blooded races of Aquarfall. e_sunken28_a_dsca=That is how your adventure in the past ends.
e_sunken28_a_rp0=We are finally back to present Aquarfall.
e_sunken28_a_rp0_s=After crossing the portal and recovering from the dizziness caused by that type of travel, you all take some time to gather your thoughts. After the rebellion against the Great Bird and its cult, the naga rose to leadership among the cold-blooded races and ended up oppressing the other races. <br><br>However, without the support of a creature like the Great Bird, their control was not absolute, and their rule eventually crumbled, along with the temple they used as their seat of power, leading to the Aquarfall you know. <br><br>Unfortunately, you didnt find any trace of the priestess who originally made the rebellion triumph, but you hope that, thanks to your intervention, her sacrifice will no longer be necessary.
e_sunken28_a_rp1=Sss... So, this is how it started.
e_sunken28_a_rp1_s=(Thuls): "Sss... I never thought I would experience how my people earned their freedom. After the Great Bird, we had to live under the naga regime, but alongside the crocomen, we waged war against the naga and won.<br><br>We hold ritual fights with the crocomen to commemorate that event. Aquarfall should never suffer under a tyrant like the Great Bird again.<br><br>I hope my people never forget how costly it was for us to gain our freedom."
e_sunken28_a_rp2=It was even more terrible than the stories I had heard.
e_sunken28_a_rp2_s=(Malukah): "The followers of the Great Bird crossed every line and made all the races from the swamp hate humans, so most were forced to flee Aquarfall after the Great Bird's defeat.<br><br>Their culture was scattered around the world, and for the children of the swamp, like me, the Great Bird was just a tale our parents told us when we misbehaved.<br><br>Now that I have seen how terrible it was, I am glad it's over. I understand why there is so much hatred for it, and I hope Aquarfall will never suffer under another tyrant like the Great Bird again."
e_sunken28_a_rp3=The Great Bird was terrifying. Im glad we defeated it.
e_sunken28_a_rp3_s=(Bree): I have seen firsthand what natures corruption looks like, and I wonder if the Great Bird was acting that way because its soul was corrupted by something, or if it was simply an evil creature. I dont believe there is evil in nature; it must have been something else.<br><br>Although I understand that nature has its rules and its better not to interfere with them, I feel we did the right thing.<br><br>I believe the lessons we learned from this experience will help me better understand the rules of nature.
e_sunken28_a_rp4=It looks like everything is fine on this side of the rift.
e_sunken28_a_rp4_s=(Amelia): The rifts magic is dangerous and can produce chaotic outcomes, but I would say we managed the situation well.<br><br>Our intervention didnt alter the main events of the revolt: The Great Bird was defeated, and the naga will take the lead of their cold-blooded races alliance. However, they will eventually become tyrants, and their alliance will break. But thats another story.<br><br>I must admit I would have liked to meet the priestess who started all of this, but I guess that will have to wait for another time.
e_sunken28_a_rp5=This reminds me something.
e_sunken28_a_rp5_s=(Navalea): So, the godlike creature that everyone adored turned out to be a cruel tyrant, huh? I know that story well.<br><br>I pity the Great Birds followers, as Im sure they truly believed they were doing the right thing.<br><br>Over the years, Ive learned that the most fearsome skill of godlike creatures like the Great Bird, or even Basthet herself, isnt the power they hold but the way they shape how their followers perceive the world, leaving them unable to distinguish between good and evil. Im glad we put an end to that madness.
e_sunken28_a_rp6=Basthet wouldnt allow this to happen.
e_sunken28_a_rp6_s=(Laia): To me, its clear that the Great Bird didnt care about its followers, not like my beloved Basthet!<br><br>I hope the Great Birds followers seek Basthets enlightenment, as its evident she is far wiser than that cruel, winged creature. My goddess will surely guide them along the path to redemption.<br><br>Besides, it was only natural for us to strike the Great Bird down; after all, you know the relationship between felines and birds!
e_sunken28_a_rp7=Croak... Now I understand better the people of Aquarfall.
e_sunken28_a_rp7_s=(Gustav): I wasnt raised in Aquarfall, and I never really understood why its people were so divided. Now I think I understand.<br><br>Croak... The crocomen and the lizardmen usually engage in ritual fights against each other, although theyre at peace most of the time. But the naga... those guys are always causing trouble! They believe Aquarfall belongs to them!<br><br>Now that I think about it... there are barely any humans left in Aquarfall. I wonder where they went... Croak.
e_sunken28_a_rp8=Experiencing history is always exciting!
e_sunken28_a_rp8_s=(Wilbur): After this event, the naga, led by Shnanke the Meek, united all the cold-blooded races under their banner and hunted down the humans who refused to leave Aquarfall. The lizardmen and the crocomen were especially concerned that Shnanke and his followers were even more cruel than the Great Birds cult and attempted to depose him.<br><br>Shnanke, by then known as the Cruel, and his naga fought against every other race in Aquarfall. The Sunken Temple was largely destroyed and abandoned as a consequence of that war. The cold-blooded races never united under the same banner again.<br><br>It has been an enlightening experience to stand in the very place where the fate of Aquarfall was decided.

e_sunken2_a_nm=The zealot's chamber
e_sunken2_a_dsc=You arrive at the Zealot's Chamber, a room where pilgrims can rest before continuing their journey into the temple's depths.<br><br>An elderly couple asks your group if this is your first pilgrimage and offers some advice. They mention that they have made this journey annually for many years and know the secrets of all the altars: Golden, Spirits, Thunder, Sacred Flame, and Blood.<br><br>It seems this couple simply wants to share their wisdom with fellow pilgrims.
e_sunken2_a_dsca=Will you listen to what they have to say about any of the altars?
e_sunken2_a_rp0=Thank you but we are in a hurry.
e_sunken2_a_rp0_s=The elderly couple smiles when you tell them you're in a hurry, and they say they miss the days when they were young and always rushing.<br><br>They begin reminiscing about how different things were in their youth, but you are long gone before they can finish their story.
e_sunken2_a_rp1=What can you tell us about the Golden Altar?
e_sunken2_a_rp1_s=The couple tells you that the original purpose of the Golden Altar was to celebrate the arrival of the Great Bird, which was seen as a sunbeam of hope for the people of Aquarfall. However, nowadays, people honor the Great Bird there in the hope that it will bring them fortune and material wealth.<br><br>Those who remember the true story leave some gold near the altar, always in the smaller pile, for others who may need it. As long as you take only what you need, you are free to collect some gold from there.<br><br>After sharing the story of the Golden Altar, the couple decides to retire and rest before continuing their journey. You bid them farewell and continue exploring the temple.
e_sunken2_a_rp2=What do you know about the Spirit Altar?
e_sunken2_a_rp2_s=The couple tells you that the purpose of the Spirit Altar is to celebrate the fact that the Great Bird taught the natives of Aquarfall how to properly use magic, as before its arrival, their magic was crude and unrefined.<br><br>It is a tradition to offer magical shards of solidified magic to the Great Bird's statue. These shards are difficult to craft and expensive, but if you need some for your offering, the couple suggests looking at the ground around the altar, as there are plenty scattered there!<br><br>After sharing the story of the Spirit Altar, the couple decides to retire and rest before continuing their journey. You bid them farewell and continue exploring the temple.
e_sunken2_a_rp3=The Thunder Altar sounds interesting. What do you know about it?
e_sunken2_a_rp3_s=The couple tells you that the Thunder Altar is a place to honor the good omens the Great Bird brings to the people of Aquarfall.<br><br>They explain that the thunder aspect was once a test of valor and devotion for their ancestors, as they had to stand touching the altar for a whole day without being struck by lightning. Nowadays, however, you dont even need to touch the altar! Simply standing close to it for a moment is enough. The couple then rants for a while about how the priests have become too lenient with their rituals.<br><br>After sharing the story of the Thunder Altar and voicing their complaints about the new rituals, the couple decides to retire and rest before continuing their journey. You bid them farewell and continue exploring the temple.
e_sunken2_a_rp4=We are intrigued by the Sacred Flame Altar. What can you tell us about it?
e_sunken2_a_rp4_s=The couple smiles when you ask about the Sacred Flame Altar, as they tell you it is the most spectacular of the Great Birds altars. The elders of Aquarfall were amazed by the Great Birds sacred flame, which burns its enemies and comforts its followers. It is said that thanks to this fire, the people were able to follow the Great Bird through the darkest nights.<br><br>The elderly couple explains that this is a favorite story of the priests. The Great Bird is like a peacock, but instead of feathers, its tail is made of flames, and the flames at its altar are just for display. They also mention that you could touch the statue at the altar with your fingertips without being burned!<br><br>After sharing the story of the Sacred Flame Altar, the couple decides to retire and rest before continuing their journey. You bid them farewell and continue exploring the temple.
e_sunken2_a_rp5=The Blood Altar sounds important. What do you know about it?
e_sunken2_a_rp5_s=The couple is delighted that you asked about the Blood Altar, as it is undeniably the most significant altar in the Great Birds cult. According to its teachings, blood serves as the ultimate connection between all things, which is why it holds such a central role in the Great Birds rituals.<br><br>The elderly couple explains that for those uncomfortable with the sight of blood, there are ways to make an offering to the Great Birds statue with minimal distress. For instance, you can use the dried blood from the tools near the altar! They emphasize that what many fail to understand is that all blood is valuable to the Great Bird, it doesnt matter whether it is yours or someone elses.<br><br>After sharing the story of the Blood Altar, the couple decides to rest before continuing their journey. You bid them farewell and resume exploring the temple.
e_sunken3_a_nm=The beggars gossip
e_sunken3_a_dsc=At the side of the chamber, you find a beggar who is telling everyone who passes by that he knows the secret entrance the guards use to kidnap people without anyone noticing.<br><br>The people who pass near him try to avoid eye contact, and the guards seem to ignore him.<br><br>It is a dangerous topic, and the only reason he may still be alive is because hes either crazy or just a liar, but it might be interesting to hear what he has to say.
e_sunken3_a_dsca=Will you listen to the beggar?
e_sunken3_a_rp0=We dont have time for crazy beggars.
e_sunken3_a_rp0_s=You decide to continue your journey, doing as everyone else, avoiding eye contact with the beggar.<br><br>As you pass by him, you hear him laughing frantically.
e_sunken3_a_rp1=Lets give him 240g and see what he knows.
e_sunken3_a_rp1_s=You are experienced adventurers and know that no reliable information comes free, so you approach the beggar and offer him 240g to share his knowledge.<br><br>The beggar is both surprised and pleased that there are still some sensible people around the temple. He tells you that the side ladder that gives access to the temple is precarious on purpose, but when the guards want to kidnap someone into the temple, they use an additional, magically hidden ladder that they uncover using an enchanted feather.<br><br>The beggar gives you one of these enchanted feathers and tells you to check it for yourselves!
e_sunken3_a_rp2=We may convince him to tell us what he knows.
e_sunken3_a_rp2_s=Its clear that the beggar wants to talk, so you only need to show that youre eager to listen. You ask him about the secret entrance.<br><br>He reveals that the dangerous side ladder leading to the temple is used by the guards to kidnap people at night. Additionally, they use a magically concealed rope, which they uncover with the help of an enchanted feather.<br><br>The beggar hands you one of these enchanted feathers and urges you to see for yourselves!
e_sunken3_a_rp2_sc=Its clear that the beggar wants to talk, so you only need to show that youre eager to listen. They also rely on a magically concealed rope, which they uncover using an enchanted feather.<br><br>The beggar, pleased by your company, gives you some gold and one of the enchanted feathers, urging you to investigate the ladder for yourselves!
e_sunken3_a_rp2_f=It is clear that the beggar wants to talk, so you just need to show him that you are eager to listen. You ask him about the secret entrance.<br><br>The beggar didnt expect that someone would listen to him, and he is overly pleased when your group asks him questions about what he is saying.<br><br>After listening to him for what feels like hours, you realize that he has nothing interesting to say and leave, feeling that you have wasted some precious time.
e_sunken3_a_rp2_fc=It is clear that the beggar wants to talk, so you just need to show him that you are eager to listen. You ask him about the secret entrance.<br><br>The beggar didnt expect that someone would listen to him, and he is overly pleased when your group asks him questions about what he is saying.<br><br>After listening to him for what feels like hours without hearing anything remotely useful, you wonder what you were thinking when you decided to listen to what this madman had to say. You leave, feeling a little ashamed for not seeing through this nonsense.
e_sunken3_a_rp3=Actually, what this man is saying is true.
e_sunken3_a_rp3_s=(Tulah): "The guards let him talk because they know that if they arrest him, someone else will come along saying the same things. They prefer to leave him alone and ignore him, even though what he's saying is true.<br><br>It also serves as a reminder to the people that the guards commit those despicable acts to appease the Great Bird's bloodlust. We should continue our journey and not worry about him; that man has found safety in his feigned madness."<br><br>You follow Tulahs advice and continue exploring the temple. It seems Tulah knows what she's doing.
e_sunken3_a_rp4=This man speaks the truth. We should listen to him.
e_sunken3_a_rp4_s=You do as Nezglek advises and get close to the beggar, telling him that you believe what he is saying.<br><br>The beggar is both surprised and pleased that there are still some sensible people around the temple. He tells you that the side ladder giving access to the temple is precarious on purpose, but when the guards want to kidnap someone into the temple, they use an additional, magically hidden ladder that they uncover with an enchanted feather.<br><br>The beggar says he enjoyed your company very much and gives you one of the enchanted feathers, telling you to check the ladder for yourselves!
e_sunken3_a_rp5=Youre going to tell me what you know, buddy.
e_sunken3_a_rp5_s=(Yogger): Youd better tell me what you know, and it had better be true, or I might get angry, buddy. And you dont want to see me angry.<br><br>The beggar is intimidated by Yogger and tells you, in a trembling voice, that the guards use an enchanted feather to reveal a hidden rope ladder near the auxiliary entrance. They use it to avoid activating the great elevator at night. He offers to give you one of those feathers so you can try it for yourselves if Yogger lets him go.<br><br>(Yogger): I accept. Now give me the feather, and all the gold you gathered today, too. See? Im a reasonable werewolf. Now get out of my sight.
e_sunken3_a_rp6=Sss  Tell me what you know.
e_sunken3_a_rp6_s=(Thuls): "Sss... I wont hesitate to kill you if you lie to me. He explains that the guards use an enchanted feather to reveal a hidden rope ladder near the auxiliary entrance, which they use to avoid activating the great elevator at night.<br><br>The man hands Thuls one of these feathers and warns him that what he will discover there will not please him. Thuls nods slowly, with a determination never seen before in the lizardmans eyes.
e_sunken4_a_nm=The slaves market
e_sunken4_a_dsc=You arrive at the market, but instead of merchants, you find only guards and their prisoners.<br><br>The leader of the guards informs you that they have just suppressed a slave revolt here and that you may continue your pilgrimage to the altars, although the merchants wont be returning anytime soon.<br><br>Among the chained people are crocomen, nagas, and lizardmen. These must be some of the prisoners the naga mentioned when you arrived through the portal. You notice that some of them are discreetly hiding the fact that they are free from their chains, seemingly preparing for an escape.
e_sunken4_a_dsca=Will you continue your journey or help them?
e_sunken4_a_rp0=We better continue our journey.
e_sunken4_a_rp0_s=Things are about to get chaotic with this group of prisoners, so you decide to continue your journey before you get involved in something you can't escape from.
e_sunken4_a_rp1=We should inform the guards that the prisoners appear to be plotting something.
e_sunken4_a_rp1_s=You inform the guards that some of the prisoners' chains appear to be loose. The guards check them, and it is indeed true. At least we can gather some resources before leaving this place.<br><br>You collect some magical shards before leaving the camp, remnants of alchemy experiments.

e_velka7_d1_rp1=rptd_e_aquar48_c1_rp1
e_velka7_d1_rp1_s=There are notable similarities between the crest you discovered in Senenthia and the symbols on the boxes, so you decide to open the crates and take a look inside.<br><br>Inside, you find some stone and various construction materials that are of no use to you, along with a few documents. The documents are barely legible, but they appear to have belonged to the Cartia family, a branch of the Casthak noble house dedicated to trade and transport.<br><br>As you examine their notes, you learn that the Cartia family always prioritized Senenthias interests over their own profits. These crates are part of their final shipment, abandoned when the route became unprofitable and they ran out of funds.<br><br>House Cartia served as custodians of the Senenthian people, always providing for their needs, until their resources were completely depleted.

e_ulmin6_b1_rp1=rptd_e_aquar48_c1_rp1
e_ulmin6_b1_rp1_s=There are notable similarities between the crest you discovered in Senenthia and the symbols on the wall, so you decide to take your time to try and read them.<br><br>The text is written in both Ulminian and Senenthian, accompanied by icons for those who cannot read. Thanks to this, you are able to understand the story it tells: it describes the cooperation between Senenthian House Micral and the people of Ulminin during a great famine that ravaged the desert.<br><br>House Micral, already bound to Ulminin by cultural and commercial ties, dedicated all their resources to aiding the people of Ulminin when the famine struck, distributing food freely to those in need.<br><br>In gratitude, the people of Ulminin engraved this story onto the walls so that everyone would remember House Micral's generosity and kindness.

I wasnt aware of this particular story in Ulminin.<br><br>But Im certain the crest we found in Senenthia does not represent House Micral. We should look elsewhere."<br><br>Before leaving, you notice a small chapel containing some shards for those in need, serving as a reminder of House Micrals generosity. e_voidlow4_b_nm=The book of heraldry
e_voidlow4_b_dsc=Amid the debris of what appears to be an ancient building, a faint spark catches your eye. It seems the magical aura protecting a book has successfully preserved this particular volume and its nearby treasures from the erosion of time.<br><br>Unfortunately, the same magical aura prevents you from touching the book.<br><br>Only when you notice that the crest you discovered in Senenthia is glowing with a similar light do you understand: the answer to the crest's mystery lies within that book.
e_voidlow4_b_dsca=At last, we can solve the mystery!
e_voidlow4_b_rp0=Lets put the emblem and the book together and see what happens.
e_voidlow4_b_rp0_s=When you place them together, the energy from the book is absorbed by the emblem, deactivating the shield protecting the book and allowing you to read it.<br><br>The book details the emblems of noble houses that fought in the Archon Wars. This crest belongs to House Ader.<br><br>House Ader was a beloved house that achieved several key victories in the war against the Archons. Through their leadership, those who fought alongside them were able to overcome any adversity.<br><br>Unfortunately, the house was exterminated in a battle where they chose to fight the enemy to buy time for their allies to escape. Those saved that day, thanks to House Aders sacrifice, incorporated part of Aders crest into their own to honor the act.<br><br>The most prominent house to adopt this tradition was House Casthak. Over time, however, its meaning was forgotten.<br><br>Before leaving, you gather some resources that were also protected by the books shield. 
e_voidlow4_b_rp1=We can open the book with the emblem. I know this mechanism.
e_voidlow4_b_rp1_s=(Amelia): This book is fascinating. It talks about the different noble houses that fought in the Archon War, and here is the symbol weve been searching for.<br><br>It belongs to House Ader, a beloved house that achieved several key victories during the war against the Archons. Through their leadership, those who fought alongside them were able to overcome even the greatest adversities.<br><br>Tragically, the house was wiped out in a battle where they chose to stand against the enemy, buying time for their allies to escape. Those saved that day, thanks to House Aders sacrifice, incorporated part of Aders crest into their own as a way to honor their heroic act.<br><br>The most prominent house to adopt this tradition was House Casthak. Over time, however, the crests meaning was forgotten.<br><br>This is a profound revelation. I will share this knowledge with House Casthak once my daughter is rescued. Lets gather the treasure before leaving.
e_voidlow4_b_rp2=I believe the book will open if we put the crest near it.
e_voidlow4_b_rp2_s=(Andrin): This book is about the different noble houses that fought in the Archon War, but hey, here is the symbol weve been searching for.<br><br>It belongs to House Ader, a beloved house that achieved several key victories during the war against the Archons. Through their leadership, those who fought alongside them were able to overcome even the greatest adversities.<br><br>Tragically, the house was wiped out in a battle where they chose to stand against the enemy, buying time for their allies to escape. Those saved that day, thanks to House Aders sacrifice, incorporated part of Aders crest into their own as a way to honor their heroic act.<br><br>The most prominent house to adopt this tradition was House Casthak. My house! I cant believe that we forget the crests meaning.<br><br>This is a profound revelation. I will share this knowledge with my brother once our mission is completed. Lets gather the treasure before leaving.
e_voidlow4_b_rp3=This is one of those systems that will open if we put the two pieces together.
e_voidlow4_b_rp3_s=(Reginald): This book is about the different noble houses that fought in the Archon War. Interesting... Through their leadership, those who fought alongside them were able to overcome even the greatest adversities.<br><br>Tragically, the house was wiped out in a battle where they chose to stand against the enemy, buying time for their allies to escape. e_voidlow4_b_rp5_s=(Evelyn): This book is fascinating. It talks about the different noble houses that fought in the Archon War, and here is the symbol weve been searching for.<br><br>It belongs to House Ader, a beloved house that achieved several key victories during the war against the Archons. Through their leadership, those who fought alongside them were able to overcome even the greatest adversities.<br><br>Tragically, the house was wiped out in a battle where they chose to stand against the enemy, buying time for their allies to escape. Those saved that day, thanks to House Aders sacrifice, incorporated part of Aders crest into their own as a way to honor their heroic act.<br><br>The most prominent house to adopt this tradition was House Casthak. Over time, however, the crests meaning was forgotten.<br><br>This is a profound revelation. I will share this knowledge with House Casthak once the princess is safe. Lets gather the treasure before leaving.

e_aquar49_a_dsc=You are walking on the wooden bridge when you hear a soft buzz. e_aquar49_a_dsca=Would you like to cross the rift?
e_aquar49_a_rp0=Its a new place to explore. Lets go!
e_aquar49_a_rp0_s=As the great adventurers you are, you decide to jump into the rift in case it closes.<br><br>Before you realize it, you are on the other side, and although you feel a little dizzy, you recognize this place. e_aquar49_a_rp1=You dont have time to cross it, so you decide to ignore it.

e_dream6_nm=The Dream Mill
e_dream6_dsc=You come across an old windmill, but its blades spin without any wind.<br><br>As you get closer, you notice the mill isn't grinding grain  it's grinding dreams. Wisps of colored smoke pour from the windows, and you can hear the sound of sleeping people inside.<br><br>A sign by the door says "Sweet Dreams  50 Gold Per Night." The miller appears to be asleep at his post, but his eyes are wide open and glowing.
e_dream6_dsca=What will you do?
e_dream6_rp0=<color=#333>[Pay for the night]</color>  Pay according to the sign and spend the night in the mill.
e_dream6_rp0_sc=The miller wakes up and smiles: "It's been a long time since someone paid honestly. For this, you shall get the best sleep possible." You plunge into dreams where you gain knowledge and powers of great heroes from the past.
e_dream6_rp0_s=Dreams come soft and restorative. You see pleasant memories and wake up full of energy and optimism.
e_dream6_rp0_f=Your dreams fill with nightmares of other sleepers. The miller shakes his head: "Sometimes other people's dreams seep through. Sorry, but I won't return the payment."
e_dream6_rp0_fc=The mill captures your mind in a loop of repeating nightmares. "You paid for sleep, but didnt specify what kind," laughs the miller. You have to fight materialized fears.
e_dream6_rp1=<color=#333>[Wake the miller]</color>  Try to bring the miller to his senses.
e_dream6_rp1_sc=The miller blinks, and his eyes become normal. "My God, how long have I slept in this cursed trance? Thank you for freeing me! Now I can offer you real rest, not these artificial dreams."
e_dream6_rp1_s=The miller slowly comes to his senses. "I I was trapped in my dreams. The mill feeds on dreams, but in return gives only illusions of peace. Be careful with its gifts."
e_dream6_rp1_f=The miller wakes up abruptly and angrily shouts, "Who dares disturb my eternal sleep?! You don't understand what you're doing!" His anger infects the air around with negative energy.
e_dream6_rp1_fc=The awakening destroys the mill's fragile balance. "Fools! Now all dreams will break free!" screams the miller. Materialized nightmares and dreams burst from the windows.
e_dream6_rp2=<color=#333>[Go around]</color>  Pass by without interfering with the mill's work.
e_dream6_rp2_s=The miller notices your presence and nods respectfully. "Wise. Not all dreams are worth buying. Go your way, travelers." You feel approval for showing caution.
e_dream6_rp3=According to dream theory, you need to hear the sound of reality!
e_dream6_rp3_s= Scientific understanding of dreams helps properly wake the miller without harm.
e_dream6_rp4=Hey buddy! Listen to some real waking music!
e_dream6_rp4_s= Living music breaks through the sleep charms; the miller wakes with gratitude.
e_dream6_rp5=Interesting this is a dream crystal! I know how to control it!
e_dream6_rp5_s= Magical knowledge allows safe study and use of the artifact.
e_dream11_nm=The Memory Lake
e_dream11_dsc=You come across a lake that doesn't reflect the sky. Instead, the water shows strange visions  places you've never been, people you've never met, dreams that aren't yours.<br><br>The lake is beautiful, but you can feel its power. e_dream11_dsca=rptd_e_dream6_dsca
e_dream11_rp0=<color=#333>[Drink the water]</color>  Scoop and drink from the lake of memories.
e_dream11_rp0_sc=The water carries memories of history's greatest heroes. You experience their exploits; their wisdom and victories become part of your experience. "Drink and remember the deeds of the great," whispers the lake.
e_dream11_rp0_s=The cool water refreshes not only the body but also the mind. Your memories become brighter and clearer, granting clarity of thought.
e_dream11_rp0_f=Along with the water, you swallow someone's nightmares and traumas. Another's pain and fear settle in your heart, haunting you in dark moments.
e_dream11_rp0_fc=The lake floods your mind with others' memories. You forget who you are and begin living other people's lives, lost in a labyrinth of foreign fates.

e_dream11_rp1_sc=The touch opens visions of the future to you. You see dangers that lie ahead and ways to avoid them. "The future is hazy, but forewarned is forearmed," says the lake.
e_dream11_rp1_s=Warm memories of happy moments touch your soul. Someone's first love, children's laughter, and the joy of discoveries give a temporary blessing.
e_dream11_rp1_f=Your hand plunges into painful memories  wars, betrayals, losses. Another's pain burns your mind like boiling water.
e_dream11_rp1_fc=The lake won't release your hand. Whirlpools of memories try to drag you in completely. "Stay with us, become part of our memories forever."

e_dream9_nm=The Nameless Grave
e_dream9_dsc=As you move down the dream-path, you see a gravestone and decide to get closer. The grave looks fancy, but something's not right. The name on it keeps changing as you read it. Sometimes it shows names of people you know are still alive; sometimes your name appears.<br><br>Strange flowers grow around it. You can see a ghostly figure that appears and disappears. The whole place feels like it's stuck between life and death. Your gut tells you there's power here but is it safe?
e_dream9_dsca=rptd_e_dream6_dsca
e_dream9_rp0=This place is too strange, better not risk it.
e_dream9_rp0_s=You show wisdom by not disturbing the dead. The ghost notices your respect and quietly whispers, "Thank you for honoring the peace of the dead. May your path be safe."
e_dream9_rp1=<color=#333>[Pick a flower]</color>  Take one of the strange flowers growing around the grave.

e_dream9_rp1_f=The flower blackens and crumbles to dust at your touch. "Living hands cannot hold the flowers of the dead," the ghost says sadly.
e_dream9_rp1_fc=All flowers around the grave instantly blacken and die. Skeletal hands rise from the earth: "You have defiled our garden! You shall carry our curse!" The withered earth leaves dark marks on your skin.
e_dream9_rp2=<color=#333>[Touch the tombstone]</color>  Try to read or stabilize the changing name.
e_dream9_rp2_sc=Under your fingers, the letters stop flickering and form into one name. "Finally, I remember who I am," says the ghost with tears of joy. "Thank you for returning my identity to me." He disappears, leaving ancient treasures.
e_dream9_rp2_s=The name stabilizes for a few precious seconds. The ghost becomes clearer: "I almost remembered almost found peace. Your help gives me hope."
e_dream9_rp2_f=The names begin changing even faster, flashing before your eyes like a mad carousel. "Too many lives, too many deaths," moans the ghost. Your mind becomes confused by the chaos of letters.
e_dream9_rp2_fc=Among the flickering names, you see your own, carved deep into the stone. An icy hand grabs your wrist: "Now you too will be forgotten and lost, like us!" You struggle free from the spectral grip, but the cold burns deep into your soul.
e_dream9_rp3=<color=#333>[Talk to the ghost]</color>  Speak to the flickering figure.
e_dream9_rp3_sc=The ghost materializes fully and says, "I was a keeper of ancient knowledge, but death erased my name and memory. You gave me the chance to remember." He passes on to you the forgotten wisdom of ages.
e_dream9_rp3_s=The spirit answers mysteriously, "Between life and death lies a thin line. He who respects the dead receives their blessing." His words provide insight into future dangers.
e_dream9_rp3_f=The ghost speaks in the ancient language of the dead; his words sound like grinding bones. "The living should not understand the speech of the deceased." Each word causes pain to your mind.
e_dream9_rp3_fc=The ghost screams in anguish, "Why won't you let us rest?!" His cry fills your head with whispers of the dead.
e_dream9_rp4=In the name of the Light, I will return your name to you, lost soul!
e_dream9_rp4_s= Ottis's holy power stabilizes the letters on the stone. The ghost finds peace and leaves a blessing.
e_dream9_rp5=Ancestral spirits, show the way home to the wandering soul!
e_dream9_rp5_s= The voodoo ritual opens a portal to the afterlife. The ghost leaves gratefully, leaving magical herbs.
e_dream3_nm=Dream Field
e_dream3_dsc=In the center of the field sits a young shepherd boy. He's muttering numbers to himself, eyes locked on the flock. "Thirty-one no, forty-three wait, it was sixty-eight"<br><br>Each time  a different number. The sheep keep switching places, vanishing and reappearing. He doesn't notice you. He just keeps counting, over and over.
e_dream3_dsca=rptd_e_dream6_dsca
e_dream3_rp0=<color=#333>[Help count]</color>  Join the shepherd and try to count the sheep correctly.
e_dream3_rp0_sc=You understand that the number of sheep follows a mathematical sequence from dreams. "Finally, someone solved the puzzle!" joyfully exclaims the shepherd. "I'm free from this curse!" He generously rewards you and disappears with a grateful smile.
e_dream3_rp0_s=Your counting helps stabilize the chaos on the field. The shepherd nods gratefully: "You gave me a moment of peace. Accept my blessing, kind travelers."
e_dream3_rp0_f=Endless numbers swirl in your head. "Thirty-seven no, eighty-two" You begin mumbling like the shepherd. Your mind becomes clouded by repetitive counting.
e_dream3_rp0_fc=You get stuck in a loop of eternal counting. "Welcome to my nightmare," says the shepherd sadly. Time flows, taking your strength while you count non-existent sheep.
e_dream3_rp1=<color=#333>[Wake the shepherd]</color>  Interrupt his endless counting and bring him to his senses.
e_dream3_rp1_sc=The shepherd blinks and his eyes clear. "I I remember now! A witch cursed me for refusing to give her a sheep. Thank you for freeing me!" He tells you the secrets of the field and gives you a magic staff.
e_dream3_rp1_s=The shepherd slowly comes to his senses. "How long have I been here? Days? Years? This curse made me count sheep that don't exist. Thank you for the awakening."
e_dream3_rp1_f=The shepherd angrily turns to you. "Why are you interfering? I almost counted to the right number!" His irritation casts irresistible sleepiness upon you.
e_dream3_rp1_fc=The awakening destroys the dream's fragile balance. "What have you done?!" screams the shepherd. The sheep turn into nightmare sheep with burning eyes, and the field becomes a battlefield.
